document.heading: Scope
Typography

paragraph.run: The following typograpic conventions are used throughout this document:
Warnings are displayed with a red background.
Notes are displayed with a yellow background.
Recommendations are displayed with a green background.
Examples are displayed with a gray background.
Template meta-information, e.g. instructions how to use a template, are displayed with a blue margin line.
Make sure to remove these information when using the template!

paragraph.run: This section adresses the following required contents:
Reference to or definition of project-specific
The roles defined for the software development are based on the common role definitions in
The following table shows the roles and the assigned people for this project, as well as the responsibilities of each role:

Trace Initial Software Requirements to Software Architecture
Add Risk Control Measures to Software Requirements
Add Security Control Measures to Software Requirements

Review and Update the Threat Model
Monitor Effectiveness of Risk Control Measures
Decompose Software Items Into Software Units
Develop Detailed Design of Software Unit
Define Software Engineering Life Cycle Model
Coordinate between Software Engineering and Product Development
Assign Software Engineering Roles and Responsibilities
Define Software Development Standards and Methods
Plan Procedures for Avoiding Common Software Defects
Release Software for Utilization on Product Level
Plan Timely Delivery of Security Updates
Evaluate Impact of Changing the Software

document.heading: Software Engineering Life Cycle

paragraph.run: The software engineering life cycle follows the model defined in the “
The following figure provides a brief overview on the Software Engineering Life Cycle spanning across the product development
The Software Engineering Life Cycle distinguishes two layers in which software engineering
Project layer: The project layer comprises the complete set of
needed to deliver a finished software ready for being released for
Release layer: The release layer comprises
. A software development project is made up of one or more software releases. A software release might generate a
that is or could be released to
, or it might generate a completed, consistent set of functionalities intended only for internal use (e.g. for product integration and/or
In addition to the execution layers, the
is run through only once and comprises the planning of the software development and
approach as well as the initial setup (e.g.,

, build process, or configuration management) for the software development project. The scope is outlined by an initial software requirements analysis and software architecture. In addition, the initial
of the software releases. For each software release, it splits up into the following sub-phases:
: Based on the scope of the software release, the software design is further refined and implemented which also includes the advancement of the documentation. The
is continuously integrated and tested on each level of integration. Eventually, a

is created which is a stable software version that is considered complete, i.e. all features and functionalities planned for this software release have been designed, implemented and integration tested.
, design verification activities for the software release candidate are planned and executed formally, i.e. producing formal verification records. These
typically rely on and use already existing tests prepared in previous
but may also leverage older verification results. Note that meanwhile, the development of the next software release may start.
, the final software release (“production release”) is prepared. It is checked that all
have been conducted and the documentation has been completed. The
are evaluated and considered as acceptable. Handing over the final software release to phase
as well as the creation of a

Injury or damage the health of people or damage to property or the environment.
Circumstance in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more
or service is intended according to the specifications, instructions and information provided by the
We believe the Level of Concern is
if failures or latent design flaws are unlikely to cause any injury to the patient or operator.
We believe the Level of Concern is

if a failure or latent design flaw could directly result in minor injury to the patient or operator. The Level of Concern is also moderate if a failure or latent flaw could indirectly result in minor injury to the patient or operator through incorrect or delayed information or through the action of a care provider.
We believe the Level of Concern is

if a failure or latent flaw could directly result in death or serious injury to the patient or operator. The Level of Concern is also major if a failure or latent flaw could indirectly result in death or serious injury of the patient or operator through incorrect or delayed information or through the action of a care provider.
Series of all phases in the life of a
or system, from the initial conception to final decommissioning and disposal.
Natural or legal person responsible for construction

paragraph.run: Any instrument, apparatus, implement, machine, appliance, implant, in vitro reagent or calibrator,
, material or other similar or related article, intended by the
to be used, alone or in combination, for human beings for one or more of the specific purpose(s) of
diagnosis, prevention, monitoring, treatment or alleviation of disease,
diagnosis, monitoring, treatment, alleviation of or compensation for an injury,
investigation, replacement, modification, or support of the anatomy or of a physiological process,
providing information for medical purposes by means of in vitro examination of specimens derived from the human body,
and which does not achieve its primary intended action in or on the human body by pharmacological, immunological or metabolic means, but which may be assisted in its function by such means.
